title: RuntimeError: dimension out of range (expected to be in range of [-2, 1], but got 2)
body_html:
The following code caused an error RuntimeError: dimension out of range (expected to be in range of [-2, 1], but got 2) in v0.2.0 while it worked well in v0.1.2. Is this a dimension bug in v0.2.0?

torch.max(score_maps.view(n, n_scales, -1), 2).squeeze(2) # score_map.size() = [n, n_scales, h, w]
body_text:
The following code caused an error RuntimeError: dimension out of range (expected to be in range of [-2, 1], but got 2) in v0.2.0 while it worked well in v0.1.2. Is this a dimension bug in v0.2.0?
torch.max(score_maps.view(n, n_scales, -1), 2).squeeze(2) # score_map.size() = [n, n_scales, h, w]
body:
The following code caused an error `RuntimeError: dimension out of range (expected to be in range of [-2, 1], but got 2)` in v0.2.0 while it worked well in v0.1.2. Is this a dimension bug in v0.2.0?
```python
torch.max(score_maps.view(n, n_scales, -1), 2).squeeze(2) # score_map.size() = [n, n_scales, h, w]
```
